website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix L110 definitely offers a lot for the money, but it still has the photos and shooting performance of an entry-level point-and-shoot.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift for my daughter....
customer_reviews.text: who emailed me the most stunning picture (after she learned how to operate the camera, of course) taken while she was walking, of a flowering bush with a magnificent butterfly at rest....The shot was clear, the colors breathtaking....That's the best I can say re the camera.....My daughter selected the camera, make and model, sent me the info with a price she had gotten somewhere online....I came directly to amazon.com and saved a pretty penny, which includes an additional purchase for a Transcend Memory Card! Amazon did it again--they have never failed me yet and so I am a happy consumer and faithful customer. Go amazon.com!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and customers service was fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera and rockymountainbrown was very responsive and super nice. In the product description it tl you what it comes with but when you buy used it doesnt tell you what it comes with so i thought that was the general information that will be shipped with the product. He issued me a partial $10 refund so i could get the strap because thats really just the only part i wanted/ needed besodes the camera because it runs on batteries and came with those. He handled the situation perfectly. I recommend buying from this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: WASN'T PLEASED, RETURNED IT FOR CREDIT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Nikon Coolpix 5700 in 2004. I still own it and it is still taking beautiful photos. I did want to buy a new Nikon Coolpix camera, and liked the body style. I received this camera and shot a few pics on "point and shoot" setting. I was incredibly disappointed. The photos were fuzzy, just flat poor quality. I do not know if this particular camera was a fluke of some kind. I returned it immediately. It was a fraction of the cost of my original Coolpix 5700. I am inclined to believe "you get what you pay for" in life.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio Sun 46

customer_reviews.title: Good hybrid camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking middle of the line product. Its pretty easy to use. Zoom is of nice range. A couple of issues I have with this camera. It requires pretty good illumination fot it to take bright pictures. If the room is a little dark, the LCD starts grainy and pictures comes out less bright (yellowish) Flash is manually operated which is a hassle if you in a time senstive moment. Video quality is decent. Although not at par with other HD recorders. Even smartphone's HD video quality is better than this camera. Overall, although not a junk, Could have been better. Lot of room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: sandyT

customer_reviews.title: replacement camera
customer_reviews.text: So far, we are pleased with this camera. We have not had it long enough to make a fair evaluation.
customer_reviews.author: C. Russ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Sony DSC-H5 for my work as a home photographer. The Nikon Coolpix L110 was a perfect replacement for the Sony. The picture between flashes was really quick compared to the Sony. I'm using rechargeable AA batteries in it and I was able to take a lot of pictures (roughly about 600 some with the flash) before I had to replace the batteries. I'm glad I switched over to Nikon. I was aware of the brand since I already own a D3100 but I wanted something more compact and lightweight. Plus I really didn't want to use my DSLR on the job site.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Agustin

customer_reviews.title: she loves it
customer_reviews.text: we got this as a gift for a high school senior who needs her own camera for college. she takes a lot of portrait-style pictures of the children she babysits. we have been very pleased with this camera. she has had NO difficulty learning to use it and the quality of the product is very good. only complaint, and it is really just a quibble, is that it didn't come with any kind of case whatsoever. Not even a cheapie one. So we had to go out and get a case right away, which if we had realized that we would have ordered one with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: pushkins

customer_reviews.title: great point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: We have had the camera for almost a month now and so far happy with it. Great LCD, recovery time between shots, automatic mode great for amateurs. Have used it for indoor and outdoor, and night time shots with no problems. The reason I bought this camera was for the 15X zoom as my old camera had a 6X and it didn't quite do the job. The only problem so far is we're having trouble getting the HD video to play back on our HDTV. This may be operator error but have not had a chance to thoroughly investigate why it is not working properly. It plays alright as a non high-def video though. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera to start a new hobby. I have no real photography experience. I received my used Nikon Coolpix L110 and I couldn't be happier with my first impression. The camera was provided in a timely manner and works perfectly. As it was described, there are a couple of minor spots indicative of prior use. These are so minor I only mention them because the camera was so well disclosed. Everything was provided in the original box with CD, strap,cords and manuals. I even got the batteries. LOL
customer_reviews.author: scott2132

customer_reviews.title: reviewcam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as a gift and he decided he wanted to keep it and he really enjoy taking pictures with it. The delivery came quickly and carefully wrapped in bubble plastic nice and secure and I would say that the flash dose not work which is why I'm only giving it 4 stars. The quality of the pictures are clear and sharp. My son likes it and that is what really matters.
customer_reviews.author: shaelyn

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this camera except...
customer_reviews.text: You can't plug it in to recharge the batteries! I bought the Sanyo Eneloop 4 Pack AA NiMH Pre-Charged Rechargable Batteries, w/ Charger. That way I can always have four batteries in my camera while four batteries are charging. Also, I notice some of the posts on this camera notice pictures being blurry and out of focus. If this is happening to you try setting the camera on Sport Continuous. That will stop your problem. I leave mine on Sport Continuous most of the time and get very good, clear shots.
customer_reviews.author: MS1903

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L110 review
customer_reviews.text: This camera is pretty good for the money. I got it on sale here for just under $200 and was fairly impressed with it. I am still learning what all of the "modes" are and what the camera will do but I am pleasantly surprised. Things I love about this camera is AA batteries, point and shoot with ease, LOVE LOVE LOVE the sports mode on it! Things I don't love - some of my pictures are blurry. If you don't have $700 - $1000 for a camera but can afford this one at $200 it would be the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures and video.
customer_reviews.text: We have many great photos taken with this camera. And video too. Alas my wife dropped it (she does that with a lot of things). Now it takes pictures where one corner is very soft. As such we have moved on to something that takes equally great pictures in a smaller package. Panasonic LUMIX DMC-ZS30
customer_reviews.author: Doug Price

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L110 12.1 MP Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Nice for Macro and medium zoom shots. The long zoom seems blurry most of the time. Could be that the light weight makes the thing hard to hold steady. My older Sony H1 8MP 10x zoom is much better on the long shots. Shutter seems slow. I like the flash, really lights up a room, and the manual flip-up is great. It is a keeper at the AMZ price ($229). Have paid 10 times this for Canon DSLR lenses. Point being, for a walk-around picture taker at a car show, picnic, whatever, this fills my needs.
customer_reviews.author: P. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I received the camera for Christmas and have been taking videos and pictures since. The pictures turn out very good, but indoors you do need to use the flash or the colors come out weird. The video is good, but sounds aren't very loud. I have been using the standard settings. I haven't figured out yet how to do action pictures without getting blurry, but I guess it would help if I would read the rest of the manual. All in all it is a good camera with lots of features.
customer_reviews.author: vanclan

customer_reviews.title: Unfulfilled Promises!
customer_reviews.text: I immediately tried "Easy Auto Mode" to see if this camera lived up to its promise. My approach is generally to first see what a camera will do without utilizing "bells and whistles", especially when the manufacturer highlights the competency of the easy mode. Although the LCD screen was clear and bright, as soon as I zoomed at all, the image on the screen became blurry. Sometimes it would clear up quickly; other times not at all. For that reason I returned the Nikon Coolpix L110.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L. White

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: By reading other peoples reviews I decided on this camera bc thie price was in my range,and the zoom was what caught my attention. I've had this camera for a month now and I'm still finding out new things. the only thing I dislike is when you press the button to take the picture the pictures come out blury. The setting I use is portiat and close up mainly. And they turn out fine. I am a canan only but took a chance on nikon and i dont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Hana Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend who has this exact camera. We compared notes and found that neither of us likes this camera. I am about to sell mine at a yard sale. The pictures, especially those taken at a distance are fuzzy. Even the special uses, flowers, portraits, are not satisfactory. The picture quality is terrible, not sharp, unclear, fuzzy edges. I am really disappointed in this camera. I thought with the name Nikon I could not go wrong, but this is not a good camera. I bought a $50 point and shoot camera for my son and it takes excellent pictures. I will invest in one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera - Still
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Nikon, Coolpix S7c for the last four years with much success. The Nikon Coolpix L110 is a great improvement. Although larger it is easier to hold, has great features like manual pop-up flash, lens cover and operates on AA batteries. It operates similar to the S7c so there was very little getting up to speed time required. REVIEW UPDATE: I've been using the L110 camera for almost a year now and like it even more!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A. Vanslambrouck

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for the AA battery use
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that took AA batteries. Don't trust myself to keep the special batteries charged. I've missed out on a lot of photo ops waiting for batteries to charge. Lithium batteries have long life with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: coolpics with Nikon coolpix
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to upgrade my Kodak camera which began to take much to long to focus after zooming in on a subject. So far Nikon is doing a better job. The pictures are crisp and clean even when zooming in. The only draw back is that this camera has no manual setting (which I knew prior to purchasing)..It's a point and shot camera that does not give you the opportunity to grow and learn. That's fine if that's all you need and want.
customer_reviews.author: Quintessential

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L110
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, just about all the things that you need or would like to have on this type of camera except they forgot to put a view finder on it. If you want to take pictures in the open sun light areas you can't see a thing in the LCD monitor, you just point it in the direction that you want and hope you get what you want, or stand in the shade or indoors, maybe carry a dark cloth to put over your head and the camera, no wait, that is what George Eastman did in the early 1900. I would give this camera a 9 out of 10 rating, because of no view finder.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pittrof

customer_reviews.title: Card in Camera not Nikon Accepted
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera. However, the Transcend brand memory card that came with the camera malfunctioned while I was on vacation in British Columbia. The batteries died while transferring photos from camera to computer. I lost 15 irreplacable photos plus the memory card is now marked "cannot be used". Nikon informs me that the Transcend brand memory card is not approved by Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: pcarriesmith

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera for the enthusiastic
customer_reviews.text: Want to get serious about photography but with an quality camera without spending the big bucks just yet? Look no further. Takes great pictures, easy handling with more stuff than the average cameras and you will not want to sell it when you finally get your big interchangeable lenses camera. This will be your all around+vacations camera even after you get your pro camera.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Poor functioning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my wife a little over two years ago. We both have used it and do not like it at all. Don't even think you can take action photos of your grandkids with it! We can't seem to get the settings to match the same scene. I'm fed up with it. Worst camera I've ever had. I'm disappointed in Nikon on this one. Mine still looks brand new and I'm ready to trade it for a Sony camera.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: order as described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera awhile ago, and have had no issues with this. I bought this because I recently had a baby and trying to get those quick pictures with my phone just wasn't working. This camera is very easy to use and I am glad I bought it. And thank you for the note in the box too :) I have definitely enjoyed having this camera. Thanks again!!
customer_reviews.author: Chula86

customer_reviews.title: love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: i ordered this camera back in october, and it is so easy to use! it's a nice point and shoot camera with slr qualities. i got my camera "used - like new" for only $92! so i have zero complaints! if my memory serves me, i believe it arrived on time. i remember it was packaged well, bubble wrap all over the camera, undamaged. i use this camera almost every single day. i love the manual flash, i love the macro setting, the zoom is wonderful, and the shake reduction is especially great.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: best camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: Our old Kodak wasn't keeping up with our boys on the ball field, and we didn't have the money for a top of the line (or bottom of the line, for that matter) DSLR. I think this camera is the next best thing. The Nikon L110 meets our needs for sports shots and everyday picture-taking. I highly recommend reading the instructions and taking time to play with different picture settings because this camera has a lot to offer, especially if you're upgrading from a camera with few features. Judging by the pictures posted by others with this camera, I've only scratched the surface of what this camera can do.
customer_reviews.author: gingersnapp

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Nikon L110 that I have owned. I obviously love it because I keep coming back. The close up option is my favorite because I can get such amazing pictures with a very inexpensive camera. :) The only down side is the flash. The flash on my first 2 L110's went out and that is why I purchased the others.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunna514

customer_reviews.title: Hey there - smile
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this camera a few months ago. I so enjoyed using it that I bought one for myself. Can take some great sports shots if the lighting is pretty good. Easy to operate. Many different settings - haven't been able to try them all out yet. Not too big but substantial enough that I don't feel like my hands get in the way when I'm taking pictures. I'm going to have fun with this camera in Paris!
customer_reviews.author: L. Ash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is wonderful!! For me it takes professional photos!! It takes some getting use to operate but take pro quality photos....I'm an artist and would recommend it...A+++
customer_reviews.author: Gayle P. Weatherford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for a mid-range camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was purchased to replace an older model Canon. Much research had been done among the top brands. This has been an excellent purchase decision. The zoom range is adequate for most shots, especially among cameras of similiar price. The previous Canon has been a good camera but nothing close to this one as to features and quality of photos.
customer_reviews.author: Will Gee

customer_reviews.title: It is okay
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, and I think the red color got me more then anything else. Takes nice pictures outside but inside at sporting events the pictures didn't come out that great at all which was the main purpose for this camera for me. Videos are actually pretty good. ALso pictures inside at kids concerts don't come out very good either. Was hoping I could get some good inside pictures with this, but does take good outside pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Loved it but didn't get to use it very long before a wildfire took everything from me, including pics on this camera and the memory card installed in it. Would recommend to anyone for ease of use and great pics!
customer_reviews.author: kyranew

customer_reviews.title: Satisified customer
customer_reviews.text: I found some discrepancy with the camera upon receiving the camera. 10 mp vs. 12.2mp deep scratches on viewing lens ect. I feel that that seller did not know of this error in sending me the camera. I have cancer and needed to documents my condition for the VA. With a camera. After giving my rating the seller contacted me via email and the seller did all they could to please me and to make the situation right. I would highly recommend the seller to all for the courteous way this seller made it a win-win situation
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The Coolpix is really "cool"!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love my camera! It takes awesome pictures and the HD videos are amazing! I haven't taken it on any photo taking trips yet, just pictures of family and friends but so far, so good!! My last camera was a Canon, which got passed down to my daughter when I bought this one! This Nikon is a much better camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera took wonderful pics. The only downsize is the weight and size. I was really used to a point n shoot camera, so this is a bit larger and heavier. I wouldn't trade it for one though. The zoom is amazing! Pic quality far and close up is the best I've seen. Great camera for the money. Highly recommend to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: THE Worst
customer_reviews.text: The worst photos I have ever taken and I have taken tens of thousands. I went to a party and used this camera for the first time,I shot 222 photos with it,about75% were bad ie blurred !!!!! I took about a hundred photos with my old point & shoot and they were very clear. If I am doing something wrong can someone tell me what ?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa O.

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L110
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter to upgrade and replace her previous camera. She loves using it, loves the features and I use it to take action shots when my kids play baseball and softball. I love being able to take continual shots so I don't miss any action. Fair price for the features.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I have had it for a few weeks now so I have a good understanding of its functions. I use this camera for several different things. I am a deputy sheriff and use this camera for basic crime scene pictures. I am also the web page administrator for the local FOP (Faternal Order of Police), and use this camera for all pictures for the site. It has worked very well for both functions.
customer_reviews.author: Deputy Dog

customer_reviews.title: a good camera for non-experts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my father-in-law. He likes it very much. It is easy to use, especially for non-experts like my father-in-law. Including both camera and camcorder in a single machine is a plus for people demand portability. The video quality is OK, better than my previously owned camcorder with standard definition (320p), but is inferior to those with higher definition(e.g., 1080p). But it is sufficient for us. My only concern is the photo quality. It seems to me the color of photos is bias to either yellow or blue. I re-set the white balance several times but do not improve much.
customer_reviews.author: X. Yu

customer_reviews.title: has the annoying habit of turning off automatically at the absolute worst ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera was just okay. Not up to Nikon standards. Eats batteries, has the annoying habit of turning off automatically at the absolute worst time after inactivity. Then you have to click the aperture button to get it to reboot and turn itself on, which takes 3 or 4 seconds by which time the picture you wanted is no longer there.
customer_reviews.author: Russel Don LeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Love this acmera
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera, the only negative will be the batteries size - I would prefer only one battery. Otherwise is fine. the camera takes good close-up pictures, self adjusts for good lighting and it is easy to carry around. recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Yoji

customer_reviews.title: nikon coolpix L110
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much yet, I purchased it for my trip to Italy in a months time. So far, I like it. The menu is a little difficult to manage, and wish there was one button just for type of picture I want to take. I hope after using more, I will have learned the correct sequence to access the menu. The zoom works great, and have a couple close shots that look clear and sharp. Also the battery door is a little difficult to snap shut.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Nothing negative so far
customer_reviews.text: Since I am not a big camera guru, my review probably means little. But my wife and I wanted a camera that had a better zoom. After doing a lot of research into cameras using Consumer Report, this camera had some of the best ratings among its competition. It was right at $200, and so far, we love it.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera!! Easy to use, takes awsome pictures! Has so many great settings on it to get that perfect picture! It is a little akward to carry, but I like to carry mine in my purse. Over all its the best camera for the money. Its a good price on Amason. At Best Buy they were wanting some where around $220. I got this camera on Amazon for $187! Over all this is an amazing camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Starla

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a little less than a month now, but I use it at least 4 days a week. I use the macro feature to take close ups of my artisan jewelry. It takes great close ups! I also have a Cannon Rebel XT but I prefer my new Nikon coolpix. The transfer software it comes with is easy to use as well. I look forward to trying out the video function in the future.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kavan

customer_reviews.title: it's worth every pennie
customer_reviews.text: This is so far one of the best cameras i've ever had, and believe me I've had a lot of cameras. The print quality it's very good, as well as the pictures. The video it's not that great but it's a picture camera not a video one even though it has that capability. The only thing I don't like about this item, it's that when taking pictures in motion the quality goes down tremendously. This probably will become a bigger problem if you have kids that play some sort of sport, like I do.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gavidia

customer_reviews.title: great if you don't have the budget for a dslr
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to tide me over until I can afford a Canon digital rebel and I might buy a Nikon now instead! Clear crisp photos as long as you have the right light. A little noise with low light and the videos isn't perfect, but if you want perfect video why use your point and shoot? GREAT for portraits!!!!! but don't forget to turn off the image stabilization if you are using a tripod! This camera feels great in your hand and is easy to use and even though there isn't a manual setting, you can change some of the auto settings, the rest you can do in photoshop anyways.
customer_reviews.author: MLHS

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the first high optical zoom digital I've owned. It does take a little bit to learn all the features, as this little camera is pretty packed with different options. The only true drawback I can find with this camera is the issue of only 3mp pictures at 3200 and 6400 ISO. The video and audio are both surprising good for a camera. I've previously had a couple of Fuji cameras, and they came nowhere close to a comparable video quality. I have yet to use the panaorama maker, but from the examples they provide, I'm looking forward to some great pictures this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Scout Leader

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera! It takes amazing pictures. I have no problem getting great shots of my kids, who are constantly in motion. This camera is a big leap above a basic point and shoot, take time to read the manual and understand how to use it well. After reading about it, I am taking wonderful photos! The batteries that came with it lasted long enough to take 1045 pictures, and some HD videos as well! I recommend this camera to anyone who is ready for a step above a point and shoot, but not quite ready for a DSLR
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted this camera for the last year and half. Been waiting till I had the money. I got it for a special trip and was not dissapointed. It took great pictures indoors and out. I loved the special museum setting, just perfect! The smile finder is great. I have not learned to use the video yet but will soon. Thanks for a great experience on my first quality camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie65

customer_reviews.title: review of camera
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the amount of internal memory. I took the camera away with me and found out it would only hold 11 pictures. I think I could of changed a setting, but didn't learn about that until I came home. I had planned on buy more internal memory, I just felt that the camera should have come with more.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: good but no SLR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's birthday. She really likes the camera. The only thing that I don't like is there is no eye piece, you look at the screen. Too many chances for shakey pictures and focus problems. I love my slr camera, but she would never a slr camera to it's potential.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Dowden

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas, and she's enjoying it a lot. She has taken many pictures, and the quality is wonderful. The resolution is clear, and the shutter speed is twice as fast as her last camera. The zoom is amazing, as is the video. She's thrilled to finally have a camera with super zoom, HD video, a bigger LCD display, and a great sports mode for action shots. Not the best camera for portability, but certainly worth its weight in wonderful photography.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen A.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, especially you don't need remember about battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, especially you don't need remember about battery charging. Just keep extra 4 AA with you. Quality is great for this price, well you are not buying a $1000 camera, so don’t expect more for this money.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: ... streaks in photos and on display screen i would love this camera
customer_reviews.text: If it weren't for streaks in photos and on display screen i would love this camera. Definitely not happen with my photo quality
customer_reviews.author: jennifer smart

customer_reviews.title: Love my Nikon Coolpix
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability of over ridding the settings. The videos are outstanding from this camera. I was pleasantly surprised. My only hangup is that the flash is not automatic. You must remember to lift the flash housing. It does take some time to learn all the features of the camera but I now have had this for 24 months and I am still very happy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Baron

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had an easier camera to operate, plus it takes amazing pictures! You can just figure out the super easy stuff to do or get into things like the panoramic pictures you can take with this camera. Either way, you will be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Heather N. Lord

customer_reviews.title: REPLACED OLDER COOLPIX WITH THIS & AM NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.text: Indoor pics are not clear & I'm still working to see if I can overcome that. Other Nikon was older & starting to act up so I replaced it with this - not good. From now on I'm not buying a camera that someone else hasn't used so I can see the results.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase and the price was the best considering all the different stores selling this model. It is very easy to use and I am able to pick up the camera and start shooting. It does well in low light conditions. I rarely use the flash but it's there if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ravacade

customer_reviews.title: for the price you and ease of use for beginner photography it was an overall good
customer_reviews.text: have had this camera for years now and the main complaint i have about it is the non adjustable focus for it... but.. for the price you and ease of use for beginner photography it was an overall good buy
customer_reviews.author: Marcio Escapa

customer_reviews.title: Using The Nikon Coolpix L110
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a step above just point and shoot. I really wanted to replace the HP we have been using for some time as it did the job we needed and truly was point and shoot. However, that model is no longer available, so, knowing Nikon for many years decided to give it a go. We will eventually understand this one I'm sure, in the mean time the photos that are pretty bad we will delete and try-try-try again!! lol One reason I chose this Camera is: It uses double 'A' batteries. Most Cameras are using Propriatary Batteries today which are costly and certainly not available at your local market if you need one.
customer_reviews.author: Pards Valley

customer_reviews.title: A Real Nikon Deal
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new camera and had seen this one used by someone in my family. Really wanted one but felt I couldn't afford it. It was suggested I look on Amazon so I did and was able to get it for $100 less than I had seen it in stores! I ordered it and had my new camera in less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: Lovepelic

customer_reviews.title: good camera bad deal
customer_reviews.text: this is my 2nd nikon l110 but my first time from seller. the camera works fine and is "like" new. but all i got was the camera. no sholder strap no lens cover. no instructions. nothing that comes in the box. my first nikon l110 i got for $25 less and it had everything and the original box.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carter

customer_reviews.title: The only downfall is having to use AA batteries to ...
customer_reviews.text: The only downfall is having to use AA batteries to power the camera, if they had used a rechargable Ni-cad battery it would be equal to any Sony on the market.
customer_reviews.author: jerry a. lay

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. Takes nice cuality pictures. Makes me remember " you press the bottom we do the rest". Sometimes y mess with the software but then i manage to put settings back to original sets.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix Review
customer_reviews.text: I think this camera is a very good camera. The only thing I have found that is questionable about it is the speed between shutters and the quality of the picture when using the zoom is pretty poor. Other than those two things it is an extremely good camera. It is a good value for the money it costs.
customer_reviews.author: BoogieBum

customer_reviews.title: Given as a gift but it doesn't take good pics. Recipient hasn't found a professional to look ...
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift but it doesn't take good pics. Recipient hasn't found a professional to look at the settings to see if it's something easily fixed. Picture color isn't true.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: Top Shelf Camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera and company are top shelf quality. My kodak fell in the river, I needed a new camera. I tried different models on display at the stores. Decided on this camera. The company is equal to the great camera quality. I will certainly need to read the manual or attend a class to learn of all great features.
customer_reviews.author: SassaFrasGranny

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality camera!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera!! Takes wonderful quality pictures. Easy to work and use! Uses SD cards and AA batteries. Nikon is a great name brand!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Bought this model a couple of months ago specifically for the "sports" photography features. I wanted good on-field soccer pictures, without spending a ton of money. The zoom is GREAT! Love the 20 second back to back shots feature also - great for capturing that perfect slo-mo shot.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beck

customer_reviews.title: You also have to be completely still in order to get a good picture.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this camera would have more features on it but I guess not. It doesn't take pictures very well inside or if you're wanting to take action shots. You also have to be completely still in order to get a good picture.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: 1st Digital
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital camera, bought at the last minute for a 3 week trip to Mexico. Worked flawlessly and the pictures seem very high quality. Uses 4 AA batteries and they are still working after over 700 pictures, viewing, downloading, etc. Wasn't sure I would like not having a viewfinder but the screen is very easy to see, even in high light situations. Still have not figured how to make the flash work. Maybe I need to read the book. Even still, the indoor pics I took came out very nice. I am very pleased with my new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: CoolPix Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter's Christmas present because we used them for the National Park I worked at. She LOVES it! it's an awesome camera with beautiful pictures and great settings.
customer_reviews.author: SecurityGirl

customer_reviews.title: great everyday camera
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this camera much yet, but so far it is great for wildlife, portraits, landscapes, etc. You must be very careful to gently squeeze the shutter button when using the zoom, because the slightest jolt will give a blurry picture. I took several pictures at full zoom without a tripod, and most were very clear. The camera is very easy to use, especially after reading the booklet. It is well worth the money for all casual picture taking.
customer_reviews.author: beek

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L110
customer_reviews.text: Nice point and shoot camera for the value. I have also used the newer model L120 which has higher zoom power and some handy features. But I am pretty satisfy with the 15X zoom on L110. Picture quality is wonderful. Easy to use - push buttom instant movie mood. Clear picture. Not like the flat body cameras, it is a bit bulky to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: Nikon make great cameras and this one is no execption. MY wife is a Filipina and if you know anything about them you know what I mean when I say she give this camera a work out. SHe loves it and uses it constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera. Love that it runs on regular batteries and the pictures are soooo great. You just have to remember to take it on trips when you go. We are so used to our phones taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: It took us a little bit to get the hang of taking pictures with such a great camera. You can point and shoot, or go manual if you like. We love this camera and are learning newer features every time we use it! It's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Rox

customer_reviews.title: Nikon L110
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Camera in reasonable price from Amazon.com. I have Kodak camera but 12 Mp Kodak camera giving very bad picture quality. So I decided to buy brand name camera and I feel its worthy money and quality wise.
customer_reviews.author: Jogesh N. Parekh

customer_reviews.title: Nice little magic camera
customer_reviews.text: The L110 is just great! If you are a professional you will be disappointed; but if you aren't and wish to improve your photographer skills, then this is the one for you!! Takes a while to figure out all the options but they really help to get the pictures you want once you know how to use them... and the money you will pay for it is ridiculous!! BUY IT, BUY IT, BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Navarro

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAM
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME CAMERA. TAKES GREAT PICS. COULDNT FIND IT AT THE LOCAL STORES SO I BOUGHT THIS ON AMAZON.COM ... IF YOU LIKE SPORTING EVENTS IT HAS A SPORTING MODE THAT TAKES 8 PICS WITH ONE PUSH OF THE BUTTON TO GET THAT PERFECT SHOT.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIWONKA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after reading reviews on this site and seeing a close up shot of the moon. However, my experience was not what I expected. I spent a week reviewing the manual and taking practice shot before I went on a once in a lifetime trip. The quality of the photos were no better than ones I have taken with a $99 camera. The video playback contained a green vertical line that distorted the image. I just returned the camera and will purchase a less expensive model
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a gift for a friend in Belarus. There, he makes great pictures and send them to me. Device works very well, the pictures are beautiful, it is convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Stark

customer_reviews.title: Seller is not good
customer_reviews.text: I returned the item to the seller unopened and they sent an email saying that they deducted 10% of the amount for restocking which was not the correct reason. When called over phone, they told me that 10% of the amount for shipping charge which was so high and I feel that the seller over exaggerated the amount. If you order and give shipping charges, for the delivery after 5 days, the charge is around $8 only whereas, this seller Electronic Express charged $22 (approx.). Better to avoid Electronic Express, though the product is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Subbu

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix L-110
customer_reviews.text: A great camera. If you are wanting an easy to use camera with a little more to offer than a compact digital, this is a great one. Superb photos, outstanding clarity. Sharp focusing. Easy to replace batteries. Not too technical, yet advanced enough for great pictures. Wonderful ergonomics. Easy to navigate through the menu. For my needs, this is a perfect fit. If you want easy but compact, maybe not the camera for you. If you want advanced photo options, maybe not the camera for you. If you are in between, this one can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the $$$!
customer_reviews.text: Use this camera Daily and love how it works for the cost! Would like it if it had a few more functions, but this is a great camera for someone not ready for an SLR but beyond a flat Point & Shoot!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wahler

customer_reviews.title: Worst camera purchase I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera once while on vacation. The second time I tried to use it, which was about a month later, I got a "Batteries Exhausted" message. I replaced the batteries numerous times with no luck. Now, it doesn't even TRY to turn on. There were so many things that I loved about this camera - mostly the AMAZING pictures it took (for about a week), the wide angle, and the incredible zoom. But this is all useless if the piece of junk won't turn on. This camera has gone from a 4.5 star purchase to a 0 star purchase in less than a month. I'm still waiting for tech support to get back to me with a resolution...
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Kewl cool pix
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement camera for a Fuji that "died" after 8 yrs of use. With the exception of a through-the-lens viewer, the camera satisfies my point and shoot for family photos; not certain it will meet my need for action photos. But, I have other cameras to meet this requirement. Little difficult to see images on the back screen in high light (sun) conditions. Quite happy with the purchase and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mountaineer62

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom and she loves it! Its so much nicer than her old one. She has used it so much and the pics come out fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Abby Joan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It has some quirks that my daughter keeps complaining about.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpx L110 Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Easy to use and takes great pictures. I highly recommend it along with a larger flash memory card by Transcend. That way you can take great video as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice camera-
customer_reviews.text: A good product with good picture quality. They say hindsight is always 20/20, and given what I know now, I would have bought the upgraded L120 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be a nice upgrade for my wife . Picture quality is just OK in my opinion.I have several NIKON products and generally like them . This really just seems to be a point and shoot with options. Not bad ,not great.
customer_reviews.author: donzbop

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Very handy and good shape camera, high technology even though is not a new model. It had a frozen moment at the very first use while taking video; I hope it won't repeat again. Just in case I bought extended warranty for 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: L110 is a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon L110 is a very good and easy to use camera. It will take some abuse and I use it in some dusty comditions much of the time. If it only had a sun hood that could be attached it would be great.
customer_reviews.author: farice

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix L110 Excellant Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the best camera I have ever had. I have had 35MM camera's in the past but nothing compares with digital. With a 4 gig card I can take over 600 pix and that is at the highest quality setting. The anti vibration/movement feature works great, and the menu is easy to use. All pictures are sharp and at a perfect exposure. I am very happy with this camera. I have not tried the video feature yet.
customer_reviews.author: Devin D. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix L110
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera for my daughter's 20th birthday. She has taken it on a cross-country trip for three weeks and has loved using it. The sports setting makes it easy to get great shots of fast moving sports. I have 2 other pocket sized Nikon cameras and have received excellent customer service. I have found that their warranty is much better than some other brands. I'm a real Nikon fan.
customer_reviews.author: S. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: bad
customer_reviews.text: Just work for 1 year, then the flash stops working, bad choice
customer_reviews.author: Evelynn Delgado Camacho

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix L110 12.1MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackZoom in on your passion with Nikon's Coolpix L110, with 12.1 effective megapixels and an incredible 15x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches. The camera's new huge bright 3.0-inch high-resolution (460k-dot) LCD lets you compose and share your pictures with family and friends. The Coolpix L110, with Nikon's 5-way VR Image Stabilization System takes incredible pictures, incredibly easy plus you can take HD (720p) video with stereo sound! Nikon's Smart Portrait System which; automatically detects your subjects face, takes a picture when they smile and warns you if they blinked.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Zoom in on your passion with Nikon's Coolpix L110, with 12.1 effective megapixels and an incredible 15x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches. The camera's new huge bright 3.0-inch high-resolution (460k-dot) LCD lets you compose and share your pictures with family and friends. The Coolpix L110, with Nikon's 5-way VR Image Stabilization System takes incredible pictures, incredibly easy plus you can take HD (720p) video with stereo sound! Nikon's Smart Portrait System which; automatically detects your subjects face, takes a picture when they smile and warns you if they blinked. 



Bring special moments closer all day with 15x optical zoom, and a long battery life 

Coolpix L110, a powerful photographic tool that blends ease-of-use with advanced shooting functions, a long-lasting battery life, and high-power zoom reach. Combining the precision optics of a Nikkor lens with the image quality and performance benefits of Nikon's innovative EXPEED digital image processing concept, the Coolpix L110 is ready to capture every special moment with quality and clarity. 

The Coolpix L110 features the compositional freedom of a 15x zoom, Nikkor lens. Covering 28mm wide-angle to 420mm super-telephoto shooting, the lens' broad focal range can readily handle everything from landscapes and group shots, to tight close-ups and shots taken from a distance that allows shooting subjects as they move or play naturally. It even covers macro shooting ability from as close as 1 cm (0.4 in.). 

The power-efficient Coolpix L110 can shoot approximately 840 still images or record 7 hours*1 of HD movie footage using the supplied Energizer Ultimate Lithium AA batteries (FR6/L91). Regular alkaline or optionally available Ni-MH rechargeable batteries can also be used, eliminating worries about running out of power virtually anywhere. 

The Coolpix L100 offers a lineup of advanced image stabilizing features*2. Nikon's Image sensor shift and Electronic VR compensate for the effects of camera shake, while Motion Detection automatically controls shutter speed. Extended light sensitivity settings as high as ISO 6400*3 add further capability that helps ensure sharper results when shooting in low light or capturing fast-moving subjects. The secure grip for the Coolpix L110 is also designed to complement these technologies by lending added stability when shooting. 

*1 Recording stops automatically after 29 minutes. This figure is based on in-house testing standards and stated for recording at 25°C with AA-size lithium (FR6/L91) batteries. Actual results may vary greatly depending on factors that include differences in ambient temperature, and the amount of zoom and autofocus operations used.
*2 The camera selects and uses only the features required to optimize each image.
*3 ISO3200 and 6400 are available only for image sizes of 3M (2048 x 1536) or smaller. 

Nikon Coolpix L110 Feature Highlights 

EXPEED digital imaging technology
Nikon's smarter approach to digital imaging technology. From image capture to processing, Nikon's comprehensive EXPEED digital imaging concept encompasses the entire picture-taking operation. EXPEED is much more than a processing engine; it is a revolution in digital photography. 



3-inch, 460k-dot TFT LCD featuring Nikon's Clear Color Display
The high-quality 3-inch Clear Color Display for the Coolpix L110 features anti-reflection coating and screen brightness adjustment, which greatly reduces reflection and improves visibility outdoors for a more vivid, clearer image preview and playback. 



High-Definition movie recording
Entertain audiences with movies that capture the entire impact of the scene with HD. The Coolpix L110 records up to 7 hours*1 of HD movie footage (720p) with stereo sound with its conveniently positioned Movie-record button. HDMI output is also available for easy in camera playback on your TV or computer.
*1 Recording stops automatically after 29 minutes. This figure is based on in-house testing standards and stated for recording at 25°C with AA-size lithium (FR6/L91) batteries. Actual results may vary greatly depending on factors that include differences in ambient temperature, and the amount of zoom and autofocus operations used. 

Sport Continuous Mode 
Sport Continuous Mode offers the added benefit of shooting as many as 20 consecutive pictures at a rapid 11.1 frames per second to capture all the excitement of most action scenes. 

Five advanced image stabilizing features* help ensure sharper results
VR Image Stabilization in action. Compensating for the effects of camera shake to realize sharper results and contribute to a more reassuring shooting experience, Image sensor shift and Electronic VR (Vibration Reduction) frees you to enjoy capturing special moments without worrying about slight hand movements. High ISO 6400 capability at any image size up to its maximum of 2048 x 1536 pixels allows faster shutter speeds when shooting in low light or capturing fast-moving subjects. Motion Detection automatically controls shutter speed and the ISO setting to compensate for subject movement as well as camera shake. And, Nikon's original BSS (Best Shot Selector) function automatically shoots a series of sequential frames and saves the one with the sharpest focus.
* The camera selects and uses only the features required to optimize each image. 

Intelligent automation contributes to carefree shooting
Easy Auto Mode simplifies photography by taking control of settings; just turn on the camera and shoot freely. Activated in Easy Auto Mode, Nikon's Scene Auto Selector eliminates the need to manually select a scene mode to match the shot, making it faster and easier to capture the moment. This function analyzes the subject and its surrounding settings and automatically selects the most appropriate of the following six scene modes to achieve optimal results--Portrait, Landscape, Night Portrait, Night Landscape, Close-up, or Backlight. 

Nikon's exclusive Smart Portrait System
Automatically detecting as many as 12 faces in the shot, Face-priority AF helps produce satisfying portraits by adjusting focus and exposure. Smart Portrait Mode* helps to faithfully record precious moments by automatically releasing the shutter when the subject smiles. Blink Warning alerts the photographer when it suspects that a subject has blinked. Now featuring faster processing speed, In-Camera Red-Eye Fix automatically corrects perceived red-eye effect before saving the image to memory.
*The Smart Portrait Mode function for the Coolpix L110, L22 and L21 operates in the same fashion as the Smile Mode function for other models. 

Nikon Coolpix L110 Other Features  * Macro shooting from as close as 1 cm (0.4 in.) 
 * 15 scene modes for optimized shooting in various settings 
 * D-Lighting 
 * Approx. 43 MB of internal memory 
 * Powered by commonly available AA-size/R6 batteries 

What's in the Box  * FR6/L91 (AA-size) lithium batteries x4 
 * UC-E6 USB Cable 
 * EG-CP14 Audio Video Cable 
 * AN-CP21 Strap 
 * LC-CP20 Lens Cap 
 * Coolpix Software Suite CD-ROM

HD Movie with HDMI output and 5-way VR Image Stabilization System
Incredible 15x wide-angle optical (28-420mm) Zoom-NIKKOR glass lens
12.1 megapixels for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
Bright 3.0-inch high-resolution HVGA (460k-dot) Clear Color Display
12.1 megapixels for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
Incredible 15x wide-angle optical (28-420mm) Zoom-NIKKOR glass lens
Bright 3.0-inch high-resolution HVGA (460k-dot) Clear Color Display
